sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Friday, the 29th of April. A very warm welcome to the programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Let's begin by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russian rockets strike Ukraine's capital, Kyiv, during a visit by Antonio Guterres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN chief says he's shocked but safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: With tensions rising between Russia and the West, Sweden is rearming and boosting its presence in the Baltic Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And social media companies are accused of failing to tackle online Islamophobia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Here in The Cube, we'll take a look at a new report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The United Nations chief and his team were left shocked but safe after Kyiv was hit by Russian shelling on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: At least one person was killed and several were injured after the first and second floor of a 25-storey residential building was partially destroyed by two missiles, according to the local mayor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It happened just after the press conference between Ukraine's president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, and Ant√≥nio Guterres following key talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I don't think that whether or not the secretary general is at the Ukrainian capital is important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: What matters is that an attack occurred and that shocked me because Kyiv is a sacred city both to Ukrainian and Russian people alike. I think this city with its extraordinary beauty, historical importance and their historical and cultural legacy represents must be spared. This naturally shocked me." Zelenskyy said a total of five rockets were fired into the capital and the Ukrainian government has brandished the attack as a heinous act of barbarism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, US President Joe Biden has asked Congress for more than 31 billion euros to support Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a dramatic escalation of the American funding and will go towards military, humanitarian and economic aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, the White House is urging other countries to continue to step up and provide a range of assistance as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The UK Foreign Office says a British soldier has been killed in Ukraine and another is missing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Unconfirmed reports say the men had joined the International Legion, a group of foreign volunteers helping to defend the war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The soldier killed was veteran Scott Sibley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: His former comrades have paid tribute to him on Facebook and set up a fundraising page in his memory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The UK Ministry of Defence has advised against travel to the Ukrainian front and says anyone found in the conflict zones engaging in illegal activities should expect to be prosecuted on their return to the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The UN Secretary General has called for a thorough investigation and accountability into what happened at Bucha.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Commons' come-after, Antonio Guterres, visited the areas of alleged Russian war crimes, describing it as a horrendous sight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian President, Volodymyr Zelensky, thanked him for visiting the destruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We value your attempts to come up with the mechanisms to de-escalate the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We need to use every chance to achieve peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is important that today the Secretary-General personally witnessed Russia's war crimes that were committed near the city of Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I am thankful to you for that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You could see with your own eyes what the occupiers from the Russian Federation have done to our peaceful people, making it clear that it was a true genocide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Moscow has always denied targeting civilians and denied any alleged human rights abuses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However, with teams on the ground in Ukraine, the International Criminal Court's prosecutor says that international law cannot be a passive spectator and insists on accountability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's prosecutor general claims that there are more than 8,000 cases and has named 10 Russian soldiers allegedly involved in humanitarian abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Some of these include sexual crimes, torture, killing civilians and bombing civilian infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow says that allegations about a nuclear threat coming from Russia are completely false.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova wrote on Telegram that Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's interview by the state TV was misinterpreted, stressing that Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service head Sergei Naryshkin has accused the US and Poland of plotting to install Polish control in several parts of western Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The spokesman for Poland's security chief Stanislav jarvin responded on twitter he called the accusations a russian information operation against the us and poland and stressed that the aim was to portray poland as a warmonger which poses a threat to the whole of nato and Europe and that it was an attempt to foster distrust between Warsaw and Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The European Commission says it will issue legal proceedings against member states which fail to implement Russian sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia is now demanding European countries pay for gas by opening up a second ruble account in Gazprom bank based on an exchange rate demanded by the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Brussels says this is a breach of EU sanctions against the Russian central bank as well as a breach of contract.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria were cut off by Russia this week for not giving it to the Kremlin's new demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: However the Hungarian government and some German energy companies have suggested they are willing to give in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As European Commission of course we are monitoring whether member states are actually enforcing sanctions and if we see that this is not the case there is also possibility for European Commission to start infringement procedures in this regard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The cutting off of gas by Russia to two EU member states came as a surprise, but certainly not a shock.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU has denounced the action as blackmail, which could backfire as it accelerates the end of Russia as a fossil fuel supplier in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Brussels says the EU is diversifying its suppliers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are able to cope with this situation and we are already for some time very intensively working on diversifying gas supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have agreement with the United States of additional LNG supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We are working with Norway, which is the second biggest supplier of stepping up their supplies with other countries. So it's clear that we cannot give into this Russia's blackmail and we must diversify away from Russia. And I would say even regardless of this development exactly in these days, we had strategically decided that we will be moving away from Russia's fossil energy." Meanwhile Brussels has announced favourable zero-tariff, zero-quota trade measures for Ukraine allowing it more easily export into the EU's market in a bid to support its economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU is also working on a sixth sanctioned package which will target Russian oil, but the issue of gas remains difficult. Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For now, one of the countries with a question of gas is most difficult is Bulgaria. Euronews reporter Jack Parrock has the story.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Russian president Vladimir Putin said that they made these moves against unfriendly countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Polish government is staunchly anti-Russian on, firstly, the invasion of Ukraine, but also on a lot of other issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Here in Bulgaria, it's slightly more complicated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There are quite big pro-Russian political factions and a number of experts have been suggesting that Bulgaria was targeted as it is a country uh that the sort of banning the gas could mean that those political factions could sort of become more vocal against this coalition government here in Bulgaria which is on very shaky ground at the moment over a number of issues including the issue of sending arms into Ukraine there is another discussion going on here in Bulgaria around the gas, though, and that is that Bulgaria has the power to actually cut off some of the transit routes, for instance, into Serbia, its northwestern neighbor, of Russian gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And obviously, Serbia is an extremely pro-Russia country at the moment as well.
